description: Critical Windows patches from CISA KEV and Microsoft advisories

kbs.description: Windows SMBv1 remote code execution (EternalBlue) - used in WannaCry and NotPetya
Netlogon elevation of privilege (Zerologon) - allows domain controller takeover
Windows Print Spooler remote code execution (PrintNightmare) - actively exploited
Windows Print Spooler elevation of privilege (PrintNightmare variant)
Windows SAM database access elevation of privilege (HiveNightmare/SeriousSAM)
Windows LSA spoofing vulnerability (PetitPotam) - NTLM relay attack vector
Secure Boot security feature bypass (BlackLotus bootkit exploit vector)
Windows BitLocker security feature bypass via WinRE exploitation
Windows Kernel elevation of privilege via appid.sys IOCTL - exploited by Lazarus Group
Hyper-V remote code execution via crafted file operations on guest VM
Microsoft Message Queuing remote code execution via crafted MSMQ packets
Windows Kernel elevation of privilege via race condition - actively exploited
Windows TCP/IP remote code execution via crafted IPv6 packets (wormable)
Scripting Engine memory corruption allowing remote code execution
Windows Mark of the Web security feature bypass - actively exploited since 2018
Microsoft Management Console remote code execution via crafted MSC files
MSHTML platform spoofing vulnerability - actively exploited
Windows Task Scheduler elevation of privilege - exploited by RomCom threat actor
Windows Common Log File System driver elevation of privilege - actively exploited
Windows Kernel elevation of privilege via race condition - actively exploited in the wild
